intro: Mitrasacme elata var. brevicalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves with a leathery texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in tropical forest understories.
